noun.description: A parchment; specifically either of two rolls of parchment for recording receipts (called in Latin the pellis receptorum) and issues (called in Latin the pellis exituum), formerly kept at the Exchequer. Now historical.
With the and capital initial. The Office of the Exchequer in which these rolls were kept. Now historical.

origin: Early 20th century; earliest use found in Encyclopaedia Britannica. Fromthe name of John Pell.
